text.__SUMMARY__: Pinus praetermissa, commonly known as McVaugh's pine, is a species of conifer in the family Pinaceae.  Originally classified as a variety of Pinus oocarpa (P. oocarpa var. microphylla) in 1909, it was promoted to specific status in 1990 after further study.It is found only in western Mexico.
text.References: Conifer Specialist Group 1998.  Pinus praetermissa.   2006 IUCN Red List of Threatened Species.   Downloaded on 10 July 2007.
